content.text:
<task>
The user has placed `CiscoPacketTracer_Ubuntu_64bit.deb` in the workspace root.
Your goal is to integrate this file into the backup package.

1.  Check if `CiscoPacketTracer_Ubuntu_64bit.deb` exists in the current directory.
2.  Move `CiscoPacketTracer_Ubuntu_64bit.deb` to `terminal_backup/`.
3.  Update `terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh` to:
    *   Prioritize looking for the `.deb` file in the script's own directory (`$SCRIPT_DIR` or `$(dirname "$0")`).
    *   If found there, use it directly without searching `$HOME`.
    *   Keep the fallback search in `$HOME` just in case.
4.  Update `terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt` to reflect that the installer is now included in the backup and will be automatically detected.

Report back when done.
</task>

content.thinking:
The user wants me to integrate the Cisco Packet Tracer deb file into the backup package. Let me break down the tasks:

1. Check if `CiscoPacketTracer_Ubuntu_64bit.deb` exists - I can see it in the file list
2. Move it to `terminal_backup/`
3. Update `terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh` to prioritize local directory
4. Update `terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt`

Let me start by reading the current install_packettracer.sh and restore_instructions.txt to understand what needs to be modified.

<files>
<file><path>terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh</path>
<content lines="1-139">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | 
  3 | # Cisco Packet Tracer Installer for Fedora/Nobara
  4 | # This script converts the .deb package and installs Packet Tracer
  5 | # Based on: https://github.com/packettracer-fedora
  6 | 
  7 | set -e
  8 | 
  9 | Red="\033[0;31m"
 10 | Bold="\033[1m"
 11 | Color_Off="\033[0m"
 12 | Cyan="\033[0;36m"
 13 | Green="\033[0;32m"
 14 | 
 15 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 16 | installer_search_path="$HOME"
 17 | 
 18 | print_status() {
 19 |     echo -e "${Green}[✓]${Color_Off} $1"
 20 | }
 21 | 
 22 | print_error() {
 23 |     echo -e "${Red}[✗]${Color_Off} $1"
 24 | }
 25 | 
 26 | install_packettracer() {
 27 |     # Find Cisco Packet Tracer installer
 28 |     localized_installers=()
 29 |     selected_installer=''
 30 | 
 31 |     echo -e "${Green}${Bold}Searching for Packet Tracer installers in $installer_search_path...${Color_Off}\n"
 32 |     c=1
 33 |     for installer in $(find "$installer_search_path" -maxdepth 1 -type f \( -name "Cisco*Packet*.deb" -o -name "Packet*Tracer*.deb" \) 2>/dev/null); do
 34 |         localized_installers[$c]=$installer
 35 |         ((c++))
 36 |     done
 37 | 
 38 |     if [[ -z "${localized_installers[@]}" ]]; then
 39 |         print_error "Packet Tracer installer (.deb) not found in $installer_search_path"
 40 |         echo -e "\nDownload the installer from:"
 41 |         echo -e "  ${Cyan}https://www.netacad.com/portal/resources/packet-tracer${Color_Off}"
 42 |         echo -e "  ${Cyan}https://skillsforall.com/resources/lab-downloads${Color_Off} (login required)"
 43 |         echo -e "\nPlace the .deb file in your home directory and run this script again."
 44 |         return 1
 45 |     elif [ "${#localized_installers[@]}" -eq 1 ]; then
 46 |         selected_installer="${localized_installers[1]}"
 47 |     else
 48 |         echo -e "${Cyan}${Bold}$((c-1)) installers found:${Color_Off}\n"
 49 |         PS3="Select an installer to use: "
 50 |         select installer in "${localized_installers[@]}"; do
 51 |             selected_installer=$installer
 52 |             break
 53 |         done
 54 |     fi
 55 | 
 56 |     echo -e "\n${Bold}Selected installer: ${Green}$selected_installer${Color_Off}\n"
 57 | 
 58 |     # Uninstall old version if exists
 59 |     if [ -e /opt/pt ]; then
 60 |         echo "Removing old version of Packet Tracer..."
 61 |         sudo rm -rf /opt/pt /usr/share/applications/cisco*-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
 62 |         sudo xdg-desktop-menu uninstall /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
 63 |         sudo update-mime-database /usr/share/mime 2>/dev/null || true
 64 |         sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force /usr/share/icons/gnome 2>/dev/null || true
 65 |         sudo rm -f /usr/local/bin/packettracer 2>/dev/null || true
 66 |         print_status "Old version removed"
 67 |     fi
 68 | 
 69 |     echo "Installing dependencies..."
 70 |     sudo dnf -y install binutils qt5-qt{multimedia,webengine,networkauth,websockets,webchannel,script,location,svg,speech}
 71 |     print_status "Dependencies installed"
 72 | 
 73 |     echo "Extracting files..."
 74 |     TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)
 75 |     cd "$TEMP_DIR"
 76 |     ar -x "$selected_installer"
 77 |     tar -xf control.tar.xz
 78 |     tar -xf data.tar.xz
 79 |     print_status "Files extracted"
 80 | 
 81 |     echo "Installing Packet Tracer..."
 82 |     sudo cp -r usr / 2>/dev/null || true
 83 |     sudo cp -r opt /
 84 |     
 85 |     # Fix postinst script for Fedora
 86 |     sudo sed -i 's/sudo xdg-mime/sudo -u $SUDO_USER xdg-mime/' ./postinst
 87 |     sudo sed -i 's/sudo gtk-update-icon-cache --force/sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force/' ./postinst
 88 |     sudo sed -i 's/CONTENTS="$CONTENTS\\n$line"/CONTENTS="$CONTENTS\
 89 |     $line"/' ./postinst
 90 |     sudo ./postinst
 91 |     
 92 |     # Add --no-sandbox flag for running on Fedora
 93 |     sudo sed -i 's/packettracer/packettracer --no-sandbox args/' /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop
 94 |     print_status "Packet Tracer installed"
 95 | 
 96 |     # Cleanup
 97 |     cd - > /dev/null
 98 |     rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"
 99 |     print_status "Temporary files cleaned up"
100 | 
101 |     echo -e "\n${Green}${Bold}Cisco Packet Tracer installation complete!${Color_Off}"
102 |     echo "You can launch it from the application menu or run 'packettracer' in terminal."
103 | }
104 | 
105 | uninstall_packettracer() {
106 |     if [ -e /opt/pt ]; then
107 |         echo "Uninstalling Cisco Packet Tracer..."
108 |         sudo rm -rf /opt/pt /usr/share/applications/cisco*-pt*.desktop
109 |         sudo xdg-desktop-menu uninstall /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
110 |         sudo update-mime-database /usr/share/mime
111 |         sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force /usr/share/icons/gnome
112 |         sudo rm -f /usr/local/bin/packettracer
113 |         print_status "Cisco Packet Tracer uninstalled"
114 |     else
115 |         echo "Cisco Packet Tracer is not installed."
116 |     fi
117 | }
118 | 
119 | # Handle command line arguments
120 | case "$1" in
121 |     -h|--help)
122 |         echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
123 |         echo ""
124 |         echo "Install Cisco Packet Tracer on Fedora/Nobara by converting .deb package."
125 |         echo ""
126 |         echo "Options:"
127 |         echo "  -h, --help       Show this help message"
128 |         echo "  --uninstall      Uninstall Cisco Packet Tracer"
129 |         echo ""
130 |         echo "Place the .deb installer in your home directory before running."
131 |         exit 0
132 |         ;;
133 |     --uninstall)
134 |         uninstall_packettracer
135 |         ;;
136 |     *)
137 |         install_packettracer
138 |         ;;
139 | esac
</content>
</file>
<file><path>terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt</path>
<content lines="1-168">
  1 | Terminal Backup Restore Instructions
  2 | ====================================
  3 | 
  4 | This backup contains terminal configuration for Nobara 42 (Fedora-based).
  5 | 
  6 | AUTOMATIC INSTALLATION
  7 | ----------------------
  8 | Run the install.sh script to automatically install and configure everything:
  9 | 
 10 |     chmod +x install.sh
 11 |     ./install.sh
 12 | 
 13 | MANUAL RESTORATION
 14 | ------------------
 15 | 
 16 | System-wide Zsh plugins referenced in terminal_backup/.zshrc:
 17 | 
 18 | - /usr/share/zsh-autosuggestions/zsh-autosuggestions.zsh
 19 |   Restore with: sudo dnf install zsh-autosuggestions
 20 | 
 21 | - /usr/share/zsh-syntax-highlighting/zsh-syntax-highlighting.zsh
 22 |   Restore with: sudo dnf install zsh-syntax-highlighting
 23 | 
 24 | - /usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh
 25 |   Restore with: sudo dnf install zsh-autocomplete
 26 |   (or clone from https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete)
 27 | 
 28 | Local plugin locations checked (no directories found to copy):
 29 | - ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins
 30 | - ~/.local/share/zsh/plugins
 31 | 
 32 | GIT CONFIGURATION
 33 | -----------------
 34 | 
 35 | Global Git configuration is backed up in .gitconfig (user: haint, email: thanhhai9x98@gmail.com).
 36 | The install.sh script will automatically restore this file to ~/.gitconfig, backing up any existing one.
 37 | 
 38 | To manually restore:
 39 |     cp .gitconfig ~/.gitconfig
 40 | 
 41 | VSCODE RESTORATION
 42 | ------------------
 43 | 
 44 | VSCode settings are backed up in the vscode/ directory:
 45 | 
 46 | - vscode/settings.json     -> ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
 47 | - vscode/keybindings.json  -> ~/.config/Code/User/keybindings.json (if exists)
 48 | - vscode/snippets/         -> ~/.config/Code/User/snippets/ (if exists)
 49 | - vscode/extensions.txt    -> List of installed extensions
 50 | 
 51 | To manually restore VSCode:
 52 | 
 53 | 1. Install VSCode:
 54 |    sudo rpm --import https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc
 55 |    sudo sh -c 'echo -e "[code]\nname=Visual Studio Code\nbaseurl=https://packages.microsoft.com/yumrepos/vscode\nenabled=1\ngpgcheck=1\ngpgkey=https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc" > /etc/yum.repos.d/vscode.repo'
 56 |    sudo dnf install -y code
 57 | 
 58 | 2. Restore settings:
 59 |    mkdir -p ~/.config/Code/User
 60 |    cp vscode/settings.json ~/.config/Code/User/
 61 | 
 62 | 3. Install extensions:
 63 |    while read ext; do code --install-extension "$ext"; done < vscode/extensions.txt
 64 | 
 65 | KILO CODE EXTENSION
 66 | -------------------
 67 | 
 68 | Kilo Code configuration is backed up in:
 69 | - vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code/ -> ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code/
 70 | 
 71 | This includes Kilo Code's modes, settings, and cached data.
 72 | 
 73 | The settings.json also contains kilo-code.allowedCommands and kilo-code.deniedCommands settings.
 74 | 
 75 | To manually restore Kilo Code configuration:
 76 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage
 77 |     cp -r vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage/
 78 | 
 79 | QDRANT VECTOR DATABASE
 80 | ----------------------
 81 | 
 82 | The install.sh script automatically sets up Qdrant using Podman with systemd for auto-start on boot.
 83 | 
 84 | What gets configured:
 85 | - Qdrant storage directory: ~/qdrant_storage
 86 | - Systemd user service: ~/.config/systemd/user/qdrant.service
 87 | - Ports exposed: 6333 (HTTP API), 6334 (gRPC)
 88 | - User lingering enabled for boot startup without login
 89 | 
 90 | To manually set up Qdrant:
 91 | 
 92 | 1. Install Podman:
 93 |    sudo dnf install -y podman
 94 | 
 95 | 2. Create storage directory:
 96 |    mkdir -p ~/qdrant_storage
 97 | 
 98 | 3. Pull the Qdrant image:
 99 |    podman pull qdrant/qdrant
100 | 
101 | 4. Create the systemd service file at ~/.config/systemd/user/qdrant.service:
102 |    
103 |    [Unit]
104 |    Description=Qdrant Vector Database Container
105 |    After=network-online.target
106 |    Wants=network-online.target
107 | 
108 |    [Service]
109 |    Type=simple
110 |    Restart=always
111 |    RestartSec=5
112 |    ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/podman stop -t 10 qdrant
113 |    ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/podman rm qdrant
114 |    ExecStart=/usr/bin/podman run --rm --name qdrant \
115 |        -p 6333:6333 -p 6334:6334 \
116 |        -v $HOME/qdrant_storage:/qdrant/storage:Z \
117 |        qdrant/qdrant
118 |    ExecStop=/usr/bin/podman stop -t 10 qdrant
119 | 
120 |    [Install]
121 |    WantedBy=default.target
122 | 
123 | 5. Enable and start the service:
124 |    systemctl --user daemon-reload
125 |    systemctl --user enable --now qdrant
126 | 
127 | 6. Enable lingering for boot startup:
128 |    loginctl enable-linger $USER
129 | 
130 | Managing Qdrant:
131 | - Check status: systemctl --user status qdrant
132 | - Stop: systemctl --user stop qdrant
133 | - Start: systemctl --user start qdrant
134 | - View logs: journalctl --user -u qdrant -f
135 | - Access API: http://localhost:6333
136 | - Web UI: http://localhost:6333/dashboard
137 | 
138 | CISCO PACKET TRACER
139 | -------------------
140 | 
141 | Due to licensing restrictions, Cisco Packet Tracer cannot be redistributed.
142 | You must download it manually from Cisco.
143 | 
144 | Prerequisites:
145 | 1. Create a free account at Cisco NetAcad or SkillsForAll
146 | 2. Download the Linux .deb installer from one of these sources:
147 |    - https://www.netacad.com/portal/resources/packet-tracer
148 |    - https://skillsforall.com/resources/lab-downloads
149 | 
150 | Installation Steps:
151 | 1. Download the .deb file (e.g., Cisco_Packet_Tracer_*.deb)
152 | 2. Place it in your home directory ($HOME)
153 | 3. Run the install.sh script - it will ask if you want to install Packet Tracer
154 |    OR run the dedicated script:
155 |    bash terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh
156 | 
157 | The installer will:
158 | - Install required Qt5 dependencies
159 | - Extract and convert the .deb package for Fedora/Nobara
160 | - Configure desktop integration
161 | - Add --no-sandbox flag for compatibility
162 | 
163 | To uninstall:
164 |     bash terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh --uninstall
165 | 
166 | BACKED UP EXTENSIONS
167 | --------------------
168 | See vscode/extensions.txt for the full list of installed extensions.
</content>
</file>
</files>

=======
install_packettracer() {
    # Find Cisco Packet Tracer installer
    localized_installers=()
    selected_installer=''

    # First, check the script's own directory for bundled installer
    echo -e "${Green}${Bold}Checking for bundled installer in script directory...${Color_Off}"
    for installer in "$SCRIPT_DIR"/Cisco*Packet*.deb "$SCRIPT_DIR"/Packet*Tracer*.deb "$SCRIPT_DIR"/CiscoPacketTracer*.deb; do
        if [[ -f "$installer" ]]; then
            selected_installer="$installer"
            echo -e "${Green}Found bundled installer: $selected_installer${Color_Off}"
            break
        fi
    done

    # If not found in script directory, search in $HOME as fallback
    if [[ -z "$selected_installer" ]]; then
        echo -e "${Green}${Bold}Searching for Packet Tracer installers in $installer_search_path...${Color_Off}\n"
        c=1
        for installer in $(find "$installer_search_path" -maxdepth 1 -type f \( -name "Cisco*Packet*.deb" -o -name "Packet*Tracer*.deb" \) 2>/dev/null); do
            localized_installers[$c]=$installer
            ((c++))
        done

        if [[ -z "${localized_installers[@]}" ]]; then
            print_error "Packet Tracer installer (.deb) not found in $SCRIPT_DIR or $installer_search_path"
            echo -e "\nDownload the installer from:"
            echo -e "  ${Cyan}https://www.netacad.com/portal/resources/packet-tracer${Color_Off}"
            echo -e "  ${Cyan}https://skillsforall.com/resources/lab-downloads${Color_Off} (login required)"
            echo -e "\nPlace the .deb file in the backup directory or your home directory and run this script again."
            return 1
        elif [ "${#localized_installers[@]}" -eq 1 ]; then
            selected_installer="${localized_installers[1]}"
        else
            echo -e "${Cyan}${Bold}$((c-1)) installers found:${Color_Off}\n"
            PS3="Select an installer to use: "
            select installer in "${localized_installers[@]}"; do
                selected_installer=$installer
                break
            done
        fi
    fi
>>>>>>> REPLACE

content.text:
<apply_diff>
<args>
<file>
  <path>terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt</path>
  <diff>
    <content><![CDATA[
<<<<<<< SEARCH
CISCO PACKET TRACER
-------------------

Due to licensing restrictions, Cisco Packet Tracer cannot be redistributed.
You must download it manually from Cisco.

Prerequisites:
1. Create a free account at Cisco NetAcad or SkillsForAll
2. Download the Linux .deb installer from one of these sources:
   - https://www.netacad.com/portal/resources/packet-tracer
   - https://skillsforall.com/resources/lab-downloads

Installation Steps:
1. Download the .deb file (e.g., Cisco_Packet_Tracer_*.deb)
2. Place it in your home directory ($HOME)
3. Run the install.sh script - it will ask if you want to install Packet Tracer
   OR run the dedicated script:
   bash terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh

The installer will:
- Install required Qt5 dependencies
- Extract and convert the .deb package for Fedora/Nobara
- Configure desktop integration
- Add --no-sandbox flag for compatibility

To uninstall:
    bash terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh --uninstall
=======
CISCO PACKET TRACER
-------------------

The Cisco Packet Tracer installer (CiscoPacketTracer_Ubuntu_64bit.deb) is now
included in this backup and will be automatically detected during installation.

Installation:
1. Run the install.sh script - it will ask if you want to install Packet Tracer
   OR run the dedicated script:
   bash terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh

The installer will:
- Automatically detect the bundled .deb file in the backup directory
- Fall back to searching $HOME if not found locally
- Install required Qt5 dependencies
- Extract and convert the .deb package for Fedora/Nobara
- Configure desktop integration
- Add --no-sandbox flag for compatibility

To get a newer version:
1. Download from Cisco NetAcad or SkillsForAll:
   - https://www.netacad.com/portal/resources/packet-tracer
   - https://skillsforall.com/resources/lab-downloads
2. Replace the .deb file in terminal_backup/ or place in $HOME

To uninstall:
    bash terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh --uninstall
>>>>>>> REPLACE
]]></content>
